info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 4 at 1:55PM PDT until September 4 at 3:54PM PDT by NWS San Diego CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, San Diego.
* WHEN...Until 354 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 155 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Julian, Hwy 78 Between Banner And S2, Cuyamaca Rancho State Park, Hwy 79 Between Julian And Lake Cuyamaca, Lake Cuyamaca, Hwy S1 Between Lake Cuyamaca And Mount Laguna, Hwy S2 Between Hwy 79 And Hwy 78, Hwy 78 Between Ramona And Santa Ysabel, Wynola and Banner. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 354 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON
